author: AFRICA-NEWS
title: China’s Shift Away From Exports Provides Cushion Against Tariffs
text:
/ ghana China’s Shift Away From Exports Provides Cushion Against Tariffs 
BEIJING—China is preparing for a trade war with the U.S. that could disrupt President Xi Jinping’s development agenda, though the country’s economy is better positioned to weather short-term shocks than just a few years ago. 
As China shifts away from exports in favor of domestic consumption, it has a better cushion against external jolts. Several economists estimated that the Trump administration’s plan to slap tariffs on as much as $60 billion of Chinese products would trim China’s economic growth rate—targeted at about 6.5%… ADVERTISEMENT
